2021 Readings

A Joint Traning Dual-MRC Framework for Aspect Based Sentiment Analysis

  • Alibaba Group, Jan 4, 2021, AAAI 2021
  • Main problem focused: solve Aspect based sentiment analysis (ABSA) i.e., extract the triplet(aspect term, opinion term, sentiment polarity) from a sentence. e.g., The ambience was nice, but the service was not so great. => (ambience, nice, positive), (service, not so great, negative).
  • Main contribution: Joint train two BERT-MRC models (one model to extract all aspect terms (AT) from the given task, and the ohther model is to extract all opinion terms (OT) and find sentiment polarity (SP) w.r.t a given specific aspect erm, both models use BERT as backbone) with parameters sharing.
  • Evaluation:
    • metrics: precision, recall, F1
    • datasets: Aspect Sentiment Triplet Extraction (AT, OT, SP), ACL, (AT, OT), data row is labelled by given a query, B “beginning of OT”, I: Content of OT, O: irrelevant to query, Semeval tasks
  • How relate to MAFEA? without ABSA, to deal with such sentence, we might need to split it into sub-sentence, and run sentiment analysis on each part. With ABSA, we could obtain better Machine Reading Comprehension (MRC).
  • TODO: try this model when it is open-sourced.

A Multi-task Learning Framework for Opinion Triplet Extraction (open-sourced)

  • EMNLP 2020, Oct 31, 2020
  • How relate to MAFEA? I tried the model, trying to use it to do aspect sentiment analysis to filtered results. However, there are a few problems:
    • this model is trained on English corpus (I trained on ec2 p2, about 30-40 mins on a 1300 sent dataset REST14)
    • according to their paper Table 2, OTE-MTL trained on REST14 gets the hightest f1 score on test dataset, and the highest score if 60.62%. Meaning that even for in-domain test, it is still not suffient to extract aspects and determine its sentiment polarity. It would be even more challenge to be used on a out-of-domain inference data. Compared to Dual-MRC, Dual-MRC outperforms OTE-MTL by a large margin. For the same dataset REST14, Dual-MRC obtains 83.73% f1 score.
    • Is it possible to retrain on our S-BERT model.

VoxPopuli: A large-scale multilingual speech corpus for representation learning, semi-supervised learning and interpretation

  • Facebook AI, Jan 2, 2021
  • Main contribution: release a large-scale multilingual corpus providing 100K hours of unlabelled speech data in 23 languages. It also has 1.8K hours of transcribed speeches in 16 European languages and their aligned oral interpretations in 5 other languages. Useful for multilingual ASR
  • Interesting findings:
    • Pretraining with in-domain unlabelled data substantially improves performance especially for low-resource languages.
    • Model pretrained on VoxPopuli outperforms with out-of-domain and (partially) out-of-language (languages not in VoxPopuli Langs).
    • self-training on VoxPopuli improves both in-domain and out-of-domain performance.

self-training

  • a classical semi-supervised approach, where unlabelled data is equipped with pseudo-labels from a supervised model and then combined with labelled data for model training.
  • often need to decide/fine-tuning the sampling ratio of labelled and pseudo-labelled data.
